intro: Sincoraea heleniceae, commonly known as the Greek bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Sincoraea heleniceae thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
